primary_phone.purpose: Confirm Phase-1 appeal mailing addresses and issuing authority routing.

serves.description: Parking citations issued by the City of Seattle are adjudicated by the Seattle Municipal Court.

how_to_recognize.notes: City citations may show a combination of letters and numbers; format varies.

submission_methods.notes: Contested citations may be submitted online, by mail, or in person at the Seattle Municipal Court.

confirm_by_phone.purpose: Confirm this is the correct mailing address and procedure for contesting City of Seattle parking citations.

verification.verified_source_note: Seattle Municipal Court Hearings by Mail page lists PO Box 34987, Seattle, WA 98124-4987 for written statements and provides phone 206-684-5600【610708974160281†L197-L213】.

sections.canonical_section_name: Port of Seattle Ground Transportation Appeals

serves.description: Ground transportation citations issued at Seattle–Tacoma International Airport or Port of Seattle properties.

how_to_recognize.notes: Port citations often include the letters 'GT' or references to Port of Seattle.

submission_methods.notes: Appeals for ground transportation citations may be submitted online, mailed, or delivered in person.

confirm_by_phone.department: Port of Seattle Ground Transportation Office
confirm_by_phone.purpose: Confirm the mailing address and procedures for appealing Port of Seattle ground transportation citations.

verification.verified_source_note: Port of Seattle appeal information page lists PO Box 68727, Seattle, WA 98168 as the mailing address for appeals and provides phone numbers 206-787-7112/206-787-5906【513716919109628†L185-L192】【513716919109628†L224-L229】.

serves.description: Parking citations issued on University of Washington Seattle campus by Transportation Services.

how_to_recognize.notes: UW citations generally show a numeric identifier and UW branding.

submission_methods.notes: Appeals must be submitted within 20 calendar days; appeals may be filed online or by mail, or delivered in person.

confirm_by_phone.purpose: Confirm the mailing address and procedure for contesting UW campus parking citations.

verification.verified_source_note: UW Transportation Services citations page states appeals may be submitted by mail but does not list an address; hours & locations page lists Campus Box 355360, 1320 NE Campus Parkway, Seattle, WA 98195 as the mailing address【781542572872933†L270-L296】【952912952242069†L250-L253】.

serves.description: Parking citations issued on North Seattle College property.

how_to_recognize.notes: North Seattle College citations typically show a numeric identifier and reference the Transportation Office.

submission_methods.notes: Appeals may be submitted in writing, via email, or scheduled in person through the Transportation Office.

confirm_by_phone.purpose: Confirm mailing address and appeal process for North Seattle College parking citations.

verification.verified_source_note: North Seattle College Appeals and Fines page lists Transportation Office address 9600 College Way North 3NC1252, Seattle, WA 98103-3599 for written appeals and provides contact phone 206-934-0060【489727046209777†L311-L315】【489727046209777†L320-L346】.

serves.description: Parking citations issued on Seattle University property managed by Impark.

how_to_recognize.notes: Seattle University citations are managed by Impark and may reference Impark’s system.

submission_methods.notes: Seattle University uses Impark’s online portal for paying and appealing citations; mail appeals are not accepted.

appeal_mail_to.missing_reason: Seattle University handles appeals exclusively online through Impark; no mailing address is provided for Phase-1 appeals.

confirm_by_phone.purpose: Confirm that appeals for Seattle University citations must be submitted online via Impark and verify there is no mailing address.

verification.verified_source_note: Seattle University parking citations page states that citations are managed by Impark and appeals must be filed through Impark’s online 'Message Us' tool; no mailing address is provided【719638199021695†L85-L103】.

serves.description: Parking citations issued on Seattle Pacific University property.

how_to_recognize.notes: SPU citations use numeric identifiers and reference the Parking Citation Petition.

submission_methods.notes: Appeals must be initiated within 10 days using an online Parking Citation Petition; mail appeals are not accepted.

appeal_mail_to.missing_reason: Seattle Pacific University requires appeals to be submitted online via the Parking Citation Petition; no mailing address is provided for Phase-1 appeals.

confirm_by_phone.department: Seattle Pacific University Office of Safety and Security
confirm_by_phone.purpose: Confirm that SPU appeals must be submitted online and verify there is no mailing address for parking citation appeals.

verification.verified_source_note: Seattle Pacific University Parking Regulations state that all appeals must be initiated within 10 days via the Parking Citation Petition and do not provide a mailing address【92473139677652†L450-L465】.

blocking_issues: University of Washington, Seattle University, and Seattle Pacific University sections lack confirmed mailing addresses or require online-only appeals; confirmation by phone is needed to verify routing.
known_gaps: Citation number patterns are based on general assumptions due to lack of published formats.
South Seattle College and Seattle Central College were not researched; additional campus authorities may exist.
King County District Court and other regional entities may issue parking citations, but their appeal processes were not included.
